text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}}**: ‚ÄúNgijabule kakhulu ukukubona udlala ngokuthula ngamabhuloksi akho, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}. Uma ngibuya, kuzobe sekuyisikhathi sokulungela ukulala. Uma usulungele ukulala, singaba nemizuzu engu-5 yesikhathi sethu sokuba sobabili sodwa.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWell done for putting on your pyjamas by yourself, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Now let‚Äôs brush your teeth. Make sure you get the ones in the back of your mouth too!‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWenze kahle ngokuzigqokisa izingubo zakho zokulala, {F2_DAUGHTER_3}! Manje ake sixubhe amazinyo akho. Qiniseka ukuthi uyawenza nalawo angemuva emlonyeni!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYou did so well getting ready for bed! Now, we have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spend together. What would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWenze kahle kakhulu ngokulungiselela ukulala! Manje, sinemizuzu engu-5 yesikhathi sisodwa sobabili esingasichitha ndawonye. Ungathanda ukwenzani?‚Äù

text: **{F2_DAUGHTER_3}**: ‚ÄúYa! Ungakwazi ukungifundela indaba engiyithandayo?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}**: ‚Äú ‚ÄúThe end‚Ä¶.‚Äù Such a lovely story! Goodnight, my baby girl. I love you very much.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDMOTHER}}**: ‚ÄúYaphela‚Ä¶.‚Äù Yaze yamnandi! Ulale kahle, ntombazane yami. Ngikuthanda kakhulu."

SourceText: üí° Learn about different emotions. There are 6 basic emotions that each send us a very specific message:
text: üí° Funda mayelana nemizwa ehlukahlukene. Kunemizwa engu-6 eyisisekelo ngayinye esithumelela umlayezo othize:

SourceText: üòÉHappy: Keep doing things that make you feel good.
text: üòÉInjabulo: Qhubeka wenza izinto ezikwenza uzizwe kamnandi.

SourceText: üòîSad: Something important in your life needs attention.
text: üòîUkudangala: Kukhona okubalulekile empilweni yakho okudinga ukunakwa.

SourceText: üî¥Angry: Stand up for ourselves and set limits.
text: üî¥Ukuthukuthela: Asizimele futhi sibeke imingcele.

SourceText: üò£Disgusted: Move away from what we don't like.
text: üò£Ukwesaba: Suka kulokho ongakuthandi.

SourceText: üëÄSurprised: Stop and pay attention for a moment.
text: üëÄUkumangela: Yima unake isikhashana.

SourceText: üö©Afraid: Run away from danger.
text: üö©Ukwesaba: Balekela ingozini.

SourceText: üé® As children get older, they learn to identify lots of other emotions, like feeling excited, frustrated, proud, lonely, peaceful, guilty, or confused.
text: üé® Njengoba izingane zikhula, ziffunda ukubona eminye imizwa eminingi, njengokujabula kakhulu, ukucikeka, ukuziqhenya, isizungu, ukuthula, ukuba necala, noma ukudideka.

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can stay calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our children. üíö
text: Lesi sifundo simayelana nokuthi singahlala kanjani sizolile futhi sehlise intukuthelo uma sibhekana nemizuzu ekhathazanayo nezingane zethu. üíö

SourceText: As you began noticing feelings, you would have noticed feelings of anger, frustration or sadness.
text: Uma uqala ukubona imizwa, uzobe ubona imizwa yentukuthelo, ukucikeka noma usizi.

SourceText: üå∑ We love our children, but stress from caregiving and other events can make us feel angry. This is a normal part of life!
text: üå∑ Siyazithanda izingane zethu, kodwa ukukhathazeka ngenxa yokuba ngumnakekeli nokunye kungasenza sithukuthele! Lokhu kuyinxenye yempilo ejwayelekile!

SourceText: üí° It is important for us to try to stay calm in order to help manage our anger so we do not hurt others.
text: üí° Kubalulekile ukuthi silawule intukuthelo yethu ukuze singabalimazi abanye.

SourceText: When I am angry at my child, I should show that I am angry so they stop misbehaving.
text: Uma ngiyithukuthelele ingane yami, kufanele ngiyitshengise ukuthi ngicasukile ukuze iyeke ukuhlupha.

SourceText: üíõ It can be very difficult when your child is misbehaving, but you should try to manage your own stress and control your anger before doing anything.
text: üíõ Kungaba nzima uma ingane yakho ihlupha, kodwa kufanele uzame ukulawula ukukhathazeka kwakho ulawule intukuthelo yakho ngaphambi kokwenza into ethile.

SourceText: üå± Taking deep breaths will help. Being angry may cause you to say or do things you will later regret.
text: üå± Ukudonsa umoya kuzosiza. Ukuthukuthela kungakweza usho noma wenza izinto ozozisola ngazo kamuva.

SourceText: üéâ That‚Äôs correct!
text: üéâ Kuyiqiniso lokho!

SourceText: {F2_GRANDFATHER} is about to spend one-on-one time with {F2_SON_8} but finds the living room in a mess. He notices that this makes him feel angry.
text: U-{F2_GRANDFATHER} usezochitha isikhathi bebobabili bebodwa no{F2_SON_8} kodwa uthola igumbi lokuphumula lihliphikile. Uyabona ukuthi lokhu kuyamthukuthelisa.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI‚Äôm feeling really angry. I am tired and my body feels tense. I just want to shout at {F2_SON_8}‚Äù.
text: **U-{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (uyacabanga): ‚ÄúNgizizwa ngithukuthele ngempela. Ngikhathele. Ngifuna ukumthethisa u-{F2_SON_8}‚Äù.

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI will Take a Pause and put on my favourite song.‚Äù
text: **U-{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (uyacabanga): "Ngizo Thatha Ikhefu futhi ngidlale ingoma engiyithandayo."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (thinking): ‚ÄúI am feeling a little better. I can think more clearly about what to do to support my little boy.‚Äù
text: **U-{F2_GRANDFATHER}** (uyacabanga): "Ngizizwa ngingcono. Sengingakwazi ukucabanga kahle ngokuthi ngizokwenzani ukweseka umfana wami omncane."

SourceText: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚Äú{F2_SON_8}, welll done for doing your homework. You might feel tired now. Let's take a 5-minute break, and after that, we can play a game together to quickly pick up the toys.‚Äù
text: **{F2_GRANDFATHER}**: ‚Äú{F2_SON_8}, wenze kahle ngokwenza umsebenzi wakho wesikole wasekhaya. Kungenzeka ukuthi uzizwe ukhathele manje. Masithathe ikhefu lemizuzu engu-5, emva kwalokho, singadlala umdlalo ndawonye wokucosha amathoyizi."

SourceText: ‚ú® Understand their feelings. For example, it may feel boring to pick up toys after having fun or ending a big task.

SourceText: ‚ú® When you see @fields.child_nickname is about to start an unwanted behaviour, distract them by asking them to do something else, before the unwanted behaviour begins or gets worse.

SourceText: This lesson is about taking care of yourself. üå±
text: Lesi sifundo simayelana nokuzinakekela. üå±

SourceText: It is normal to feel stressed as your child develops. As they grow, your relationship changes. To handle this change smoothly, you must care for yourself.
text: Kungokwemvelo ukuzizwa ucindezelekile njengoba ingane yakho ikhula. Njengoba zikhula, ubudlelwano benu buyashintsha. Ukuze ubhekane nalolu shintsho ngokushelela, kufanele uzinakekele.

SourceText: Self-care is an activity you do for yourself so you feel better and less stressed. üíö
text: Ukuzinakekela kuyinto ozenzela yona ukuze uzizwe ungcono futhi ungacindezeleki kangako. üíö

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress play for a simple activity that may help you with stress.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èCindezela la kuthi khona dlala ukuze uthole okungakusiza ekucindezelekeni.

SourceText: Here is a simple stretching and movement activity that may help you with stress:
text: Nakhu ongakwenza ukuze uzelule futhi unyakaze okungakusiza ekucindezelekeni:

SourceText: Stand up and stretch your arms up to the sky.
text: Sukuma bese welulela izingalo zakho phezulu esibhakabhakeni.

SourceText: Push away any clouds and let the sun shine down on you.
text: Dudula amafu ukuze ilanga likukhanyisele.

SourceText: Stretch to both sides.
text: Zelulele kuwo womabili amacala.

SourceText: Stretch to the front and to the back.
text: Zelulele phambili nangemuva.

SourceText: Let your hands hang by your side.
text: Lengisela izandla zakho emaceleni.

SourceText: Squeeze your shoulders tightly up to your ears as you breathe in, scrunch your eyes, and hold your breath.
text: Donsa umoya ukhuphule amahlombe akho ngesikhathi udonsa umoya, ucimezisise kakhulu amehlo akho, ubambe umoya wakho.

SourceText: Release your shoulders as you relax your body.
text: Yehlisa amahlombe akho ngesikhathi uyethisa umzimba wakho.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing to the front and back. Take four deep breaths while you do this. This is good for your lower back.
text: Zikhulule izingalo zakho futhi uzivumele ziye phambili nasemuva. Donsa umoya uwukhiphe kane ngenkathi wenza lokhu. Lokhu kuyayisiza ingxenye yomgogodla engezansi.

SourceText: Relax your arms, let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Zikhulule izingalo zakho, zishwibele emaceleni, futhi uphendule ingxenye engenhle yomzimba wakho. Izingalo zakho kufanele zishaye kancane emhlane wakho njengoba usonteleka ngapha nangapha.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles. Remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beka unyawo olulodwa phambi kolunye futhi urawundise amaqakala kancane. Khumbula ukuwaphendulela kuzo zombili izinhlangothi. Phendulela unyawo ngalunye izikhathi ezine ohlangothini ngalunye.

SourceText: Now, shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Manje, nyakazisa wonke umzimba wakho ngokushesha ngangokunokwenzeka. Unyakazise phezulu! Unyakazise phansi! Unyakazise nxazonke!

SourceText: Close your eyes and raise your arms slowly above your head as you breathe in. Lower your arms slowly to your side as you breathe out.
text: Vala amehlo akho bese uphakamisela phezulu izingalo zakho kancane ukwedlula ikhanda ube udonsa umoya kancane. Yehlisela izingalo zakho emaceleni kancane ngesikhathi ukhipha umoya.

SourceText: Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out 4 more times.
text: Phakamisa futhi wehlise izingalo zakho, donsa umoya uwukhiphe izikhathi ezingu-4 ezengeziwe.

SourceText: Take a moment to reflect on your experience.
text: Ithi ukuma kancane emva kokwenza lokhu.

SourceText: Remember that you can do this activity at any time whenever you feel like you need to release stress and energise your mind and body.
text: Khumbula ukuthi ungakwenza lokhu nganoma yisiphi isikhathi nanoma nini lapho uzwa sengathi ufuna ukukhipha i-stress nokuvuselela ingqondo yakho nomzimba wakho.

text: ‚úÖ‚¨úÔ∏è

SourceText: Home Activity! Try to stretch and move at least once every day. Can you try it now?
text: Umsebenzi Wasekhaya! Zama ukwelula nokuhamba okungenani kanye ngosuku. Ungakwazi ukukuzama lokhu khona manje?

SourceText: Excellent. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference in how you feel each day. ‚≠ê
text: Nazoke. Ukunyakaza kuwulungele umzimbeni wakho futhi kwenza umehluko endleleni ozizwa ngayo usuku ngalunye. ‚≠ê

SourceText: That‚Äôs okay. Movement will be good for your body and make such a difference to how you feel each day. ‚≠ê
text: Kulungile. Ukunyakazisa umzimba kuyinto enhle mayelana nomzimba wakho futhi kwenza umehluko ngendlela ozizwa ngayo usuku nosuku. ‚≠ê

SourceText: True or False: Children learn more when they are told what to do instead of letting them explore and play.
text: Iqiniso Noma Amanga: Izingane zifunda kakhudlwana lapho zitshelwa ukuthi zenzeni esikhundleni sokuzivumela zihambe zizihlolela futhi zidlale.

SourceText: {F3_MOTHER} wants to spend more time helping her son, {F3_SON_4}, learn by playing together. Let‚Äôs see how both of them do it:
text: {F3_MOTHER} ufuna ukuchitha isikhathi esengeziwe esiza indodana yakhe, {F3_SON_4}, fundani ngokudlala ndawonye. Ake sibone ukuthi bobabili bakwenza kanjani:

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúHi, my love. Would you like to do something fun together?‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúSawubona, sithandwa sami. Ungathanda senze okuthile okujabulisayo ndawonye?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúOoooh yes!‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúOoooh yebo!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat would you like to do?‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúUngathanda ukwenzani?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúBuild a house out of bed sheets!‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúUkwakha indlu ngamashidi ombhede!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúGreat idea! What do we need to do first?‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúUmqondo omuhle! Singaqala kuphi?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúFirst, we hang one bed sheet from the top bunk bed. It‚Äôs our first wall! We can use clothing pins to keep up the sheet.‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúOkokuqala, sihenga ishidi elilodwa lombhede kulo mbhede ongaphezulu. Lokhu kuzoba udonga lwethu lokuqala! Singasebenzisa ophini ukuze sibophe ngalo ishidi.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, well done for thinking through the steps so carefully.‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúWawu, waze wazicabanga ngokucophelela izinto esizozenza.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúThis is a wonderful bedsheet house, {F3_SON_4}‚Äù!
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúLe yindlu enhle yamashidi, {F3_SON_4}‚Äù!

SourceText: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúCan we read our bedtime story here tonight?‚Äù
text: **{F3_SON_4}**: ‚ÄúSingakwazi ukufunda indaba yethu ngaphambi kokulala namuhla kusihlwa?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYes, of course, {F3_SON_4}. That will be fun.‚Äù
text: **{F3_MOTHER}**: ‚ÄúYebo, kunjalo, {F3_SON_4}. Lokho kuzoba mnandi.‚Äù

SourceText: That's OK! üíô If you don't have time today, set some time aside to play together tomorrow.
text: Kulungile!üíô Uma ungenaso isikhathi namuhla, hlela isikhathi kusasa.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} is helping his children, {F1_SON_5} and {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, learn how to play soccer and interact with each other well:
text: U{F1_FATHER} usiza izingane zakhe, u{F1_SON_5} kanye no{F1_DAUGHTER_6}, bafunde ukudlala ibhola nokusebenzisana kahle:

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúGently kick the ball using the inside of your foot, like this.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúKhahlela kahle ibhola usebenzisa ingaphakathi lonyawo lwakho, kanje.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: ‚ÄúI want to do it now!!‚Äù
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: ‚ÄúNgifuna ukukwenza manje!!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: ‚ÄúNo, I want to do it first!!‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: ‚ÄúCha, ngifuna ukukwenza kuqala!!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúIt can be hard to wait, but we cannot all go first. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, can you suggest a way for us to take turns kicking the ball?**
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúKungaba nzima ukulinda, kodwa ngeke sikwazi ukuqala kanye kanye sonke. {F1_DAUGHTER_6}, ungakwazi ukuthola indlela yokuthi sishintshane ngokukhahlela ibhola?**

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: ‚ÄúOkay! We can make a circle, and I kick the ball to {F1_SON_5}, then he kicks it to you {F1_FATHER}, and you kick it back to me!‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_6}**: ‚ÄúKulungile! Singenza isiyingi, bese ngikhahlela ibhola ku{F1_SON_5}, bese elikhahlela kuwe {F1_FATHER}, wena ulikhahlele ulibuyisele kimi!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_SON_5}**: ‚ÄúYes, that sounds great!‚Äù
text: **{F1_SON_5}**: ‚ÄúYebo, lokho kuzwakala kukuhle!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs a fantastic idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Let‚Äôs give it a try!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúUmbono omuhle lowo, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Ake sikuzame!‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWell done, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! You took the lead, and we all had so much fun taking turns! {F1_SON_5}, you were also great at patiently waiting for your turn.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúKuhle, {F1_DAUGHTER_6}! Usiholile, futhi sonke sikujabulele kakhulu ukushintshana! {F1_SON_5}, wenze kanhle futhi ekulindeni isikhathi sakho ngesineke.‚Äù

SourceText: Let‚Äôs see how {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_13} spend one-on-one time together:
text: Masibone ukuthi u{F1_FATHER} no{F1_DAUGHTER_13} bachitha kanjani isikhathi bebobabili bodwa:

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_13}, how was your day?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: {F1_DAUGHTER_13}, belunjani usuku lwakho?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúMy day was good, {F1_FATHER}. I just came from school.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúUsuku lwami beluluhle, {F1_FATHER}. Ngisanda kubuya esikoleni.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI have 5 minutes of one-on-one time to spare before I have to drive to work again. What would you like to do together?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Nginemizuzu engu-5 yesikhathi sokuba nawe sisobabili ngaphambi kokuphindela emsebenzini. Yini ongathanda ukuthi siyenze ndawonye?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI was about to do my Science homework. The topic for the homework is to make something out of recycled materials. Could you please help me with it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Besengizoqala ukwenza umsebenzi wami wesikole wasekhaya weSayensi. Isihloko somsebenzi wukwenza into ethile ngokusebenzisa izinto ezilahliwe. Bengicela ungisiza ngawo?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúI thought of building a recycled house using old bottles, boxes, and other recycled materials. Look! I picked these up on my way home. They were thrown away by the side of the road and outside the spaza shops.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúNgicabange ukwakha indlu ngamabhodlela amadala, amabhokisi nezinye izinto ezigaywe kabusha. Buka! Ngizicoshe endleleni sengibuyela ekhaya. Bezilahlwe eceleni komgwaqo nangaphandle kwezitolo.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWhat a good idea, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Sounds like you‚Äôve thought about this a lot and want to put a lot of effort into your homework. How do you want me to help you?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Awu lowo umbono omuhle, {F1_DAUGHTER_13}! Kuzwakala sengathi ukucabangisisile lokhu futhi ufuna ukuwenza ngempela lomsebenzi wesikole wasekhaya. Mina ufuna ngikusize kanjani?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}**: ‚ÄúCould you help me clean these bottles? They will be the pillars of the house. I will make the boxes into the walls and roof of the house. Later, I thought we could paint the boxes and bottles so they look beautiful.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_13}: Baba, ngicela ungisiza ungigezela lawa mabhodlela. Azoba yizinsika zendlu. Amabhokisi azoba yizindonga nophahla lwendlu. Emva kwalokho, bengicabanga ukuthi sipende amabhokisi namabhodlela ukuze kuzoba kuhle.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúI may have some leftover paint outside the house. I can take a look later.‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Ngiyacabanga ukuthi kukhona upende osele ngaphandle, ngizoyobheka emva kwesikhashana.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúWow, it looks different now! It does not look like you used rubbish at all anymore. You also painted the walls and the roof beautifully! I think your teacher will be proud of you when she sees your homework!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: Wawu, ibukeka ihlukile manje! Ngeke uze ucabange ukuthi yenziwe ngodoti. Uphinde wapenda nezindonga nophahla kahle! Ngicabanga ukuthi uthishelakazi wakho uzoziqhenya ngawe uma esebone umsebenzi wakho wasekhaya!‚Äù

SourceText: Let‚Äôs do a quiz!

SourceText: True or False: Talking about happy feelings is not as important as sharing difficult feelings.
text: Iqiniso Noma Amanga: Ukukhuluma ngemizwa ejabulisayo akubalulekile njengokuxoxa ngemizwa ebuhlungu.

SourceText: üëÄOops! Good Try! There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. It‚Äôs important that we talk with our teens about ALL of them.
text: üëÄEish! Uzamile! Kunemizwa ewu-6 eyisisekelo: Ukujabula, Ukudabukisa, Ukuthukuthela, Ukunengeka, Ukumangala, kanye Nokwesaba. Kubalulekile ukuthi sikhulume nentsha yethu ngayo YONKE.

SourceText: üéâ That‚Äôs correct. There are 6 basic emotions: Happy, Sad, Angry, Disgusted, Surprised, and Afraid. It‚Äôs important that we talk with our teens about ALL of them.
text: üéâ Lokho Kulungile! Kunemizwa ewu-6 eyisisekelo: Ukujabula, Ukudabukisa, Ukuthukuthela, Ukunengeka, Ukumangala, kanye Nokwesaba. Kubalulekile ukuthi sikhulume nentsha yethu ngayo YONKE.

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! It is important that both boys and girls learn how to communicate about all their feelings. Boys will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it. This is important for girls, too!
text: üëÄ Eish! Uzamile! Kubalulekile ukuthi abafana namantombazane bafunde ukuxhumana ngayo yonke imizwa yabo. Abafana bazofunda ukuthi kulungile ukudumala kabi noma ukuphatheka kabi ngokuthile nokuthi kulungile ukucela usizo lapho beludinga. Lokhu kubalulekile nasemantombazaneni futhi!

SourceText: üéâ You are right! It is important that both boys and girls learn how to communicate about all of their feelings. Boys will learn that it is okay to feel upset or sad about something and that it is okay to ask for help when they need it.
text: üéâ Lokho kulungile! Kubalulekile ukuthi abafana namantombazane bafunde ukuxhumana ngayo yonke imizwa yabo. Abafana bazofunda ukuthi kulungile ukudumala kabi noma ukuphatheka kabi ngokuthile nokuthi kulungile ukucela usizo lapho beludinga.

SourceText: Last one: As parents, we can also share our feelings with our teens.

SourceText: üéâ Correct! Sharing our feelings with our teens in a calm way shows them how to do the same with their own feelings.
text: üéâ Kulungile! Ukusho imizwa yethu entsheni yethu ngendlela ezolile kuyibonisa indlela yokwenza okufanayo ngeyayo imizwa.

SourceText: Here is a comic about how you can talk about feelings with your teen during one-on-one time.
text: Nali ihlaya elimayelana nokuthi ungakhuluma kanjani ngemizwa numntwana wakho ngesikhathi ninodwa kuphela.

SourceText: {F1_FATHER} and {F1_DAUGHTER_16} are spending one-on-one time by taking a walk together. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} looks very upset.
text: U{F1_FATHER} kanye no{F1_DAUGHTER_16} bachitha isikhathi esisodwa ngokuthatha uhambo ndawonye. {F1_DAUGHTER_16} ubukeka ephatheke kabi.

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, I noticed you have less energy today and you look sad. Do you want to talk about it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚Äú{F1_DAUGHTER_16}, ngiqaphele ukuthi awunamndlandla namuhla futhi ubukeka udangele. Uyafuna ukukhuluma ngakho?"

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúOh, {F1_FATHER}. I studied so hard for my maths test and failed. I feel so sad and frustrated.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúMhh, {F1_FATHER}. Ngifunde kanzima ukuze ngibhale izivivinyo zezibalo ngifeyilile. Ngidabukile futhi ngikhungathekile.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúThat is frustrating, my girl. I know how hard you studied. Maybe we can come up with a new plan to help you with maths. Should we ask your teacher for extra help? Would you like me to talk to her or do you want to do it?‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}*: ‚ÄúKuyakhathaza lokho, ntombazane yami. Ngiyazi ukuthi ufunde kanzima kangakanani. Mhlawumbe singaqhamuka nesu elisha lokukusiza ngezibalo. Ingabe kufanele sicele usizo olwengeziwe kuthisha wakho? Ungathanda ngikhulume naye noma ufuna ukuzicelela?‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúThank you, {F1_FATHER}. I can do it! I think that might be a good idea.‚Äù
text: **{F1_DAUGHTER_16}**: ‚ÄúNgiyabonga, {F1_FATHER}. Ngingakwazi ukuyenza! Ngicabanga ukuthi lokho kungaba umqondo omuhle.‚Äù

SourceText: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúYou know, maths may be difficult for you, but I am so proud of you for studying so hard, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Other people might give up, but you keep trying. That will help you so much in life!‚Äù
text: **{F1_FATHER}**: ‚ÄúUyazi, i-maths ingase ibe nzima kuwe, kodwa ngiyaziqhenya ngawe ngokuzimisela kangaka ufunda, {F1_DAUGHTER_16}. Abanye abantu bangase bayeke, kodwa wena uyaqhubeka uzama. Lokho kuzokusiza kakhulu empilweni!‚Äù

SourceText: This lesson is about how we can keep calm and manage our anger when dealing with stressful moments with our teens. üíö

SourceText: It is normal to feel stressed as your teen develops. As they grow, your relationship changes. To handle this change smoothly, you must care for yourself.
text:
Kungokwemvelo

Kujwayelekile ukuzizwa une-stress ngesikhathi umntwana wakho isakhula. Ngesikhathi isakhula, ubudlelwane bakho buyashintsha. Ukuze ubhekane nalolu shintsho ngaphandle kokuphazamiseka, kufanele uzinakekele.

SourceText: Relax your arms and let them swing sideways, and turn your upper body. Your arms should gently hit your back as you twist from side to side.
text: Khulula izingalo zakho uzidedele zilenge emaceleni, futhi ijike ngenhla yomzimba engaphezulu. Izingalo zakho kufanele zishaye umhlane wakho kancane njengoba ujikajikisa umzimba wakho.

SourceText: Place one foot in front of the other and make small circles from the ankles, remember to turn to both sides. Do each foot with four circles in each direction.
text: Beka unyawo olulodwa phambi kolunye bese ujikelezisa unyawo lwakho kusukela eqakaleni, lokhu ukwenze kuzo zombili izihlangothi. Unyawo ngalunye lujikelezise izikhathi ezine kulolo nakulolo hlangothi.

SourceText: Now shake your whole body as fast as you can. Shake it up high! Shake it down low! Shake it all around!
text: Manje nyakazisa wonke umzimba ngokushesha kangangokunokwenzeka. Wunyakazise uye phezulu kakhulu! Wunyakazise uye phansi kakhulu! Unyakazisele yonke indawo!

SourceText: Raise and lower your arms, breathing in and out, 4 more times.
text: Phakamisa futhi wehlise izingalo zakho, udonsa umoya futhi uwukhipha, izikhathi ezi-4 ezingeziwe.

SourceText: Which is common for teens?
text: Yikuphi okuvamile mayelana nezumntwana?

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Teens often struggle with identity and self-image as they figure out who they are and what they want to be.
text: üëÄ Akulungile. Intsha bavamise ukudideka mayelana nokuzazi nangendlela abazibona ngayo ngesikhathi besakhula nanokuthi bafuna ukuba ngabantu abanjani lapho sebekhulile.

SourceText: Correct! Teens are trying to figure out who they are and what they want to be, which can be confusing and make them doubt themselves.
text: Kulungile! Izumntwana zizama ukuzazi ukuthi zingobani nanokuthi zifuna ngabantu abanjani lapho sezikhulile, okungase kudale ukudideka kuzo nokuthi zizingabaze.

SourceText: How can parents help their teens cope with mood swings during adolescence?
text: Abazali bangazisiza kanjani izumntwana zabo mayelana nokuthi zikwazi ukubhekana nendlela eguquguqukayo ezizizwa ngayo ngesikhathi zisakhula?

SourceText: Oops, try again. Parents can help by letting their teen know their feelings are okay and being there for them.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Abazali bangasiza ngokudedela abantwana babo basebasha bazi ukuthi imizwa ilungile futhi babeseduze nabo.

SourceText: You are right! Parents can help by listening to their teens, noticing their feelings, and being there for them.
text: Uqinisile! Abazali bangasiza ngokulalela abantwana babo abasebasha, babone imizwa yabo, futhi babeseduze.

SourceText: Why is it important to have healthy communication with your teen during adolescence?
text: Kungani kubalulekile ukuxoxa noMntwana wakho ngendlela enhle nefanele ngesikhathi isakhula?

SourceText: Oops, try again. Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ukuxoxa phakathi kwabazali nentsha kubalulekile ngoba kuyabasiza ukuthi baqondane futhi bathembane.

SourceText: Correct! Communication between parents and teens is important because it helps them understand and trust each other more.
text: Kulungile. Ukuxoxa phakathi kwabazali nezumntwana zabo kubalulekile ngoba kwenza kube nokwethembana kakhulu phakathi kwabo futhi bazwisisane kakhulu.

SourceText: In this lesson we are continuing to learn about the changes your teen may be experiencing as they get older. Today we are exploring social changes.
text: Kulesi isifundo sizoqhubeka ngokufunda ngoshintsho umntwana wakho umntwana abhekana nalo njengoba ekhula. Namhlanje sihlola ushintsho lokuhlangana nabantu.

SourceText: Which of the following is a common social change that teens experience?
text: Yikuphi kokulandelayo okuwushintsho oluvamile izumntwana ezihlangabezana nalo emphakathini?

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.

SourceText: Correct. Teens may feel pressure to fit in with their peers.
text: Uqinisile. Intsha ingazizwa iphoqekile ukufana nontaga bakhe.

SourceText: How can parents help their teens handle social changes?
text: Abazali bangasiza kanjani abantwana babo abasebasha ukubhekana noshintsho lomphakathi?

SourceText: Oops, try again. Parents can encourage their teen to make their own decisions and be there for them through consequences.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Abazali bakhuthaza abantwana baba abesebasha ukuzithathela izinqumo futhi babekhona mase imiphumela ivela.

SourceText: What impact can bullying have on a teen?

SourceText: ‚öΩ Having friends is very important to @fields.child_nickname because it helps them learn how to be a good friend and understand other people's feelings better. This is a big part of growing up and becoming an adult.
text: ‚öΩ Ukuba nabangani kubaluleke kakhulu ku@fields.child_nickname ngoba kumusiza ukufunda ukuba ngumgani oqotho futhi ukuqondisisa imizwa yabanye abantu kangcono. Lokhu kuyinxenye enkulu yokukhula nokuba ngumuntu omdala.

SourceText: üëÄ Your teen may want to feel like they belong with their peers and do things others think are cool. They might talk or dress like others while figuring out who they are.
text: üëÄ Umntwana wakho umntwana angafuna ukuzizwa amukelekile kontanga bakhe futhi enze izinto ezithandwa yibona. Angakhuluma noma ogqoke njengabanye abantu njengoba ezama ukuthola ukuthi ungubani.

SourceText: üòî Sometimes, when teens have a hard time making friends, they might be bullied by other kids.
text: üòî Ngezinye izikhathi, uma intsha ihluleka ukuthola abangani, kungenzeka bahlukunyezwe ngabanye abantwana.

SourceText: ‚öΩ Having friends is very important to your teen because it helps them learn how to be a good friend and understand other people's feelings better. This is a big part of growing up and becoming an adult.

SourceText: In this lesson, we continue to learn about the changes your teen may experience as they get older. Today, we are exploring their physical changes. These changes are part of the phase of reaching sexual maturity called puberty.
text: Kulesi isifundo, sizoqhubeka sifunde ngoshintsho umntwana wakho umntwana angabhekana nalo njengoba ekhula. Namhlanje, sizohlola ukushintsha komzimba. Lolushintsho luyinxenye yokufika ekukhuleni kwezocansi ebizwa ngokungena ezingeni lobudala.

SourceText: Here‚Äôs a quick quiz to see how much you know about puberty!
text: Nansi imibuzo esheshayo ukuze ubone ukuthi kungakanani okwaziyo mayelana nokuthomba!

SourceText: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for girls?
text: Yini ukungena ezingeni lobudala, futhi kujwayele ukuqala nini emantombazaneni?

SourceText: Correct! Puberty is when a person's body undergoes changes as they grow into adults. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
text: Uqinisile! Ukungena ezingeni lobudala ushintsho olwenzeka ezimbeni womuntu uma ezoba ngumuntu omdala. Emantombazaneni, kuqala eminyakeni ephakathi kwa-8 no-13.

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For girls, puberty starts between ages 8 and 13.
text: üëÄ Eish, zama futhi! Ukuthomba ushintsho olwenzeka emzimbeni womuntu uma ezoba ngumuntu omdala. Emantombazaneni, kuqala eminyakeni ephakathi kwa-8 no-13.

SourceText: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for girls?
text: Yiziphi izinguquko ezithile ezivamile zomzimba ezenzeka emantombazaneni ngesikhathi sokuthomba?

SourceText: Oops, try again. During puberty, girls go through a lot of physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ekungeneni ezingeni lobudala, amantombazane abanoshintsho lomzimba oluningi. Lokhu kubala amabele akhulayo, izinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, futhi baqala ukuba esikhathini.

SourceText: Correct! During puberty, girls undergo many physical changes. These include growing breasts, hair in the pubic and underarm areas, and starting their menstrual cycle.
text: Uqinisile! Ekungeneni ezingeni lobudala, amantombazane abanoshintsho lomzimba oluningi. Lokhu kubala amabele akhulayo, izinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, futhi baqala ukuba esikhathini.

SourceText: How can parents support their daughters during puberty?
text: Abazali bangaweseka kanjani amadodakazi abo ngesikhathi sokuthomba?

SourceText: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
text: Kulungile! Ukukhuluma ngokuthomba kubalulekile kubazali ukuze basize amadodakazi abo azizwe ekhululekile futhi enokuzethemba. Lokhu kungenza amantombazane azizwe kangcono mayelana nokukhula kwawo.

SourceText: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their daughters feel comfortable and confident. This can make girls feel better about growing up.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ukukhuluma ngokungena ezingeni lobudala kubalulekile kubazali ukuze basize abadodakazi abo akhululeke futhi azethembe. Lokhu kungenze amantombazane azizwe kancono ngokukhula.

SourceText: What is puberty, and when does it often begin for boys?
text: Yini ukungena ezingeni lobudala, futhi kujwayele ukuqala nini ebafaneni?

SourceText: üëÄ Oops! Good Try! Puberty is when a person's body goes through changes as they grow into an adult. For boys, puberty starts between ages 9 and 14.
text: üëÄ Eish, zama futhi! Ukuthomba ushintsho ezimbeni womuntu njengoba ekhula. Ebafaneni, kuqala eminyakeni ephakathi kwa-9 no-14.

SourceText: What are some common physical changes that occur during puberty for boys?
text: Yiluphi ushintsho oluvamile lomzimba okwenzeka ekungeneni ezingeni lobudala ebafaneni?

SourceText: Oops, try again. During puberty, boys go through a lot of physical changes. These include enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ngesikhathi sokungena ezingeni lobudala, amabafana babhekana noshintsho lomzimba oluningi. Lokhu kubala ukukhula kwamasende, ukukhula kwezinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, nokukhula ngobude.

SourceText: Correct! During puberty, boys undergo many physical changes. These include enlargement of testicles, growth of pubic and underarm hair, and increased height.
text: Uqinisile! Ngesikhathi sokungena ezingeni lobudala, abafana bakhekana noshintsho lomzimba kakhulu. Lokhu kubala ukukhula kwamasende, ukukhula kwezinwele kusitho sangasese nasemakhwapheni, futhi nokukhula ngobude.

SourceText: How can parents support their sons during puberty?
text: Abazali bangaweseka kanjani amadodana abo ngesikhathi sokungena ezingeni lobudala?

SourceText: Correct! Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their sons feel comfortable and confident. This can make boys feel better about growing up.
text: Uqinisile! Ukukhuluma ngokungena ezingeni lobudala kubalulekile kubazali ukuze basize amadodana abo azizwe akhululekile futhi azethemba. Lokhu kungenza abafana bazizwe kangcono ngokukhula.

SourceText: Oops, try again. Talking about puberty is important for parents to help their sons feel comfortable and confident. This can make sons feel better about growing up.
text: Eish, zama futhi. Ukukhuluma ngokungena ezingeni lobudala kubalulekile kubazali ukuze basize abadodana abo akhululeke futhi azethembe. Lokhu kungenze amadodana azizwe kangcono ngokukhula.

SourceText: Talking openly with @fields.child_nickname about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves.  Understanding the changes happening in the body can also help reduce stress around any big changes they experience.
text: Ukhuluma ukhululekile no@fields.child_nickname ngoshintsho abhekana nalo emzimbeni wakhe kungamusiza ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka mayelana nalolushintsho nokuzinakekela. Ukuqondisisa lolushintsho olwenzeka emzimbeni kungasiza ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka mayelana noshintsho olukhulu abhekana nalo.

SourceText: Talking openly with your teen about the changes they are experiencing in their body can help them reduce their stress around these changes and care for themselves.  Understanding the changes happening in the body can also help reduce stress around any big changes they experience.
text: Ukukhuluma ukhululekile nomntwana wakho umntwana ngoshintsho abhekana nalo emzimbeni wakhe kungamusiza ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka mayelana nolushintsho nokuzinakekela. Ukuqondisisa lolushintsho olwenzeka emzimbeni kungasiza ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka mayelana noshintsho olukhulu abhekana nalo.

SourceText: ‚≠ê Before you focus on supporting others, it‚Äôs important to take care of yourself.
text: ‚≠ê Ngaphambi kokuthi ugxile ekwesekeni abanye abantu, kubalulekile ukuzinakekela.

SourceText: üò£ Feeling stressed as your children grow up is normal. As your relationship with them changes, it‚Äôs important to handle this shift well, and that starts with self-care.
text: üò£ Ukuzizwa ukhathazekile ngezingane zakho njengoba zikhula, kujwayelekile. Njengoba ubudlelwano bakhe nabo bushintsha, kubalulekile ukuphatha lolushintsho kahle, futhi lokho kuqala ngokuzinakekela.

SourceText: üå± Self-care means doing things for yourself to reduce stress and make you feel better.
text: üå± Ukuzinakekela ukuzenzela izinto ukwehlisa ukukhathazeka futhi uzenze uzizwe kangcono.

SourceText: ‚è∞ Let‚Äôs learn a simple way to handle everyday stress: Taking a pause.
text: ‚è∞ Asifunde indlela elula yokubhekana nokukhathazeka kosuku: Ukuthatha ikhefu.

SourceText: ‚ôª We will use this skill frequently in future lessons, so it is important to learn it today!
text: ‚ôª Sizosebenzisa lelikhono kakhulu ezifundweni ezilandelayo, ngakho ke kubalulekile ukulifunda namhlanje!

SourceText: Taking a pause will help you manage stress and be more able to take care of others and yourself.üå±
text: Ukuthatha ikhefu kuzokusiza ukuthi ukulawula ukuphatheka kabi nokukhathazeka ukuze ukwazi ukuzinakekela wena nabanye.üå±

SourceText: Let's practise taking a pause together.
text: Masiphrakhize ukuthatha ikhefu ndawonye.

SourceText: ‚ñ∂Ô∏èPress Play to practise taking a pause together.
text: ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Chofoza uDlala ukuphrakthiza ukuthatha ikhefu ndawonye.

SourceText: Try taking a pause whenever you feel angry, overwhelmed, stressed or worried. ‚è∞
text: Zama ukuthatha ikhefu uma uzizwa uthukuthele, usindelwa noma ukhathazekile. ‚è∞

SourceText: Even a few deep breaths or connecting with the ground beneath you can make a difference. You can also take a pause with your child or teen.
text: Nokudonsa umoya kancane noma ukuxhumana nomhlaba kungenza umehluko. Ungathatha ikhefu noMntwana wakho noma intsha.

SourceText: Try taking a pause on a daily basis, even if you are feeling calm. Doing this regularly will help your brain take a pause, even in challenging situations.
text: Zama ukuthatha ikhefu nsuku zonke, noma izizwa uzolile. Ukuzijwayeza ukwenza lokhu kuzosiza ingqondo yakho ukuthatha ikhefu, nasezimweni ezinzima.

SourceText: Well done! üéâ You have learnt the importance of caring for yourself and how to take a pause. ‚ú®
text: Wenze kahle! üéâ Usufunde ukubaleleka kokuzinakekela nokuthi ukhefu ulithatha kanjani. ‚ú®
